Research

Graduates and Alumni

Colleges and Schools of the University of Divinity

Students and staff join the University through one of its Colleges or Schools, each of which is a unique learning community.

The Colleges are supported by a wide range of churches and religious orders that together resource the University as a whole.

Box Hill VIC

The School of Graduate Research (SGR) fosters a high-quality learning environment for higher degree by research students and their supervisors from pre-admission information through to post-candidature guidance and networking.

Encouraging the development of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander theologies and ministries, and decolonising the eurocentric versions of Christianity that remain dominant in this country.

Box Hill VIC

Explore programs in Counselling, Leadership, Professional Supervision and Clinical Pastoral Education that are designed to meet practitioner needs in faith-based agencies, churches, and other organisations.

Networks of the University of Divinity

A leading voice for feminist theological scholarship and a hospitable hub for engagement with feminist approaches within Australia and the region.

The Religion and Social Policy network brings theological insight into contemporary world issues and social policy debates—by stimulating research and engagement activity across the University and by building external partnerships.

The Syriac Language Research Project has two research foci: the Peshitta Syriac lexicon A Key to the Peshitta Gospels (KPG), and the International Syriac Language Project (ISLP).
